summary: This is an internal email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the opening of the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a motivational message from an Assistant U.S. Attorney emphasizing the importance of the case and providing logistical details for attending the trial's opening statements.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the primary trial announcement email, who motivates the team and provides logistical details for the trial opening.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Opening
events.description: The opening statements for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell are scheduled to begin. The event includes peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on the eve of the Ghislaine Maxwell trial opening.
The prosecutor's message contrasts the SDNY's willingness to prosecute old sex crimes (referencing 1994) with an implied criticism of jurisdictions like Florida.
The core allegation stated is that 'Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls' and 'caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.'
The logistical details indicate high anticipated interest in the trial, requiring multiple overflow courtrooms and an early arrival time for staff (8:30 a.m. start).
The tone of the correspondence is motivational, urging team support and expressing confidence in the power of truth and the jury to do the right thing.
